"Lads 1" shouted Milorddovich in a loud, self- confident, and cheery voice, obviously so elat- ed by the sound of firing, by the prospect of battle, and by the sight of the gallant Apsher- ons, his comrades in Suv6rov's time, now passing so gallantly before the Emperors, that he forgot the sovereigns' presence. "Lads, it's not the first village you've had to take," cried he. 
"Glad to do our best!" shouted the soldiers.
